page.title: 12PLAYGROUP AT KEMPSFORD
page.content: Formed in 1973, meeting three mornings a week at{Kempsford Village {Hall}to provide safe, satisfying group play for up to 24 3 to 5 year olds, the playgroup is self-sufficient. It raises the money needed for rent, heating, insurance, equipment and staff pay from fees, donations and activities. The attendance fee is 75 pence per session which also covers 1/3 pint of milk paid for by {Social {Services.}A Supervisor and her assistant are paid, while mothers, on a rota, provide voluntary support so that there is a ratio of 1 adult to 6 children. This pre-school playgoup successfully helps the child from the small family unit to socialise and develop potential within a larger group as a stepping stone to school.
